title.native: 神撃のバハムート VIRGIN SOUL

description:
10 years after the event, humans at the royal capital gather wealth, the demons are enslaved to assist with the capital's revival, and the gods lose their power due to a decrease in religious piety. The world is thrown off balance as humans, gods, and demons hold their own ideas of justice.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/110221339) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/815589398720847872)

He joined studio Bebow in 1982, where he was referred to by [Masayuki Yagi](https://anilist.co/staff/143406/), a senior of his at Engaru High School. [Yoshikazu Yasuhiko](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/) and Bebow’s founder [Tomonori Kogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/105957/) were also graduates of the same school - the latter whom he would study under after joining the studio. There he made his debut as a key animator on [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/) in the following year.

He left Bebow in the mid ‘80s and joined Pack, a small studio established by [Hiroyuki Kitazume](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/). During this time he was a follower of Kitazume’s, who has said that Onda was the one capable of replicating his drawing’s the best out of the people who worked at studio Pack. After that he joined [Atelier Giga](https://anilist.co/staff/106775/) and worked there until becoming a freelancer.

His drawings feature western-influenced delicate and sharp linework with an excellent grasp on three-dimensionality. His character art in particular is highly praised both inside and outside of the industry, which he gets to brandish whenever he works as an animation supervisor. He has stated that he prefers character design and supervision work over working as an animator himself.

In 2003, he took part as a key animator on [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/)'s animated segment in Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" directed by [Kazuto Nakazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101474/). He is also a huge fan of shoujo manga since a young age due to his older sister.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山本沙代) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sayo_Yamamoto)

Renowed Anime Director, known for the critically acclaimed anime series [Michiko & Hatchin](https://anilist.co/anime/4087/Michiko-to-Hatchin/), [Lupin the Third: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine](https://anilist.co/anime/13203/Lupin-the-Third-Mine-Fujiko-to-Iu-Onna/) and [Yuri on Ice](https://anilist.co/anime/21709/Yuri-on-Ice/).

After graduating from the College of Art and Design in Tokyo she joined Studio Madhouse as Production Assistant. She had her directing debut at age 25 on [X](https://anilist.co/anime/156/X-TV/) after which she became freelance.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Persona 5 (Video Game, 2016) (OP Director, Storyboard)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/若林厚史)

Veteran Japanese animator, storyboard artist, and director. After joining [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) and then [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), Wakabayashi finally landed at [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/), where he was considered the backbone of the studio's animation in the 90s. 

He is known for his bombastic animation style, which makes the designs he draws look malleable and often exaggerated. He was influenced by animators such as [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/) and [Kouji Morimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100066/), and he is also a friend of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/). His direction is inspired by Japanese live-action cinema as well as French directors such as Luc Besson.

Wakabayashi gained considerable notoriety on the NARUTO series, which he was invited to work on by [Hayato Date](https://anilist.co/staff/100843/) after a chance meeting at Pierrot. He is best known for storyboarding and directing episode 167 of [NARUTO: Shippuuden](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/): Naruto vs. Pain.

His main focus in anime these days is more on storyboarding, as he feels that the changes in the anime industry do not allow him to animate as freely as he used to.

__Graduated:__ Toyo University

During school Sawai always aimed to be manga artist. After graduating from Toyo University he joined Tatsunoko Production where he became a storyboard artist and later episode director. He served two more years as a production assistant there until he left and became a freelance episode director. Today he works mainly for Bee Train, whose founder Kouichi Mashimo is a good friend of his.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山本沙代) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sayo_Yamamoto)

Renowed Anime Director, known for the critically acclaimed anime series [Michiko & Hatchin](https://anilist.co/anime/4087/Michiko-to-Hatchin/), [Lupin the Third: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine](https://anilist.co/anime/13203/Lupin-the-Third-Mine-Fujiko-to-Iu-Onna/) and [Yuri on Ice](https://anilist.co/anime/21709/Yuri-on-Ice/).

After graduating from the College of Art and Design in Tokyo she joined Studio Madhouse as Production Assistant. She had her directing debut at age 25 on [X](https://anilist.co/anime/156/X-TV/) after which she became freelance.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Persona 5 (Video Game, 2016) (OP Director, Storyboard)

[Website](http://daoko.jp/) | [Blog](http://daoko.life/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/daok0) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daoko_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIzc1_X3OAFquArF3EOVeWw) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/daok0) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@daoko.official) __Introduction:__ DAOKO is a Japanese female vocalist, rapper and lyricist. She first gained popularity in 2012, at the age of 15, when one of her uploaded videos on Nico Nico Douga received attention. Biography: DAOKO released her first album, *"Hyper Girl: Mukougawa no Onna no Ko"* in December 2012 through *Low High Who? Production*. In December 2013 she released a sophomore album titled *"GRAVITY"*. She received a lot of attention for her collaboration with TeddyLoid for *"Me!Me!Me!"* (a song featured in an animated short for [Nihon Animator Mihonichi](https://anilist.co/anime/20947)) in November 2014. DAOKO was nominated for Next Break Artist at the MTV Video Music Awards Japan 2015. DAOKO left *Low High Who? Production* after releasing her album *"Dimension"* in February 2015, and subsequently shut down her blog. She released her self-titled album *"DAOKO"* via *Toy's Factory* a month later. DAOKO started her first tour in January 2016. In December 2017 she released the album *"THANK YOU BLUE"*. In December 2018 she released *"私的旅行 (Shiteki Ryouko)"*. In October 2019 she collaborated with mobile game *Dragalia Lost* to release *"DAOKO×Dragalia Lost"*. DAOKO's 2017 single *"Uchiage Hanabi"* for Studio Shaft's anime movie [Uchiage Hanabi, Shita kara Miru ka? Yoko kara Miru ka?](https://anilist.co/anime/97908) is the most viewed anime song on YouTube, with over 400 million views. She won the *2018 Space Shower Music Award* in the Song of the Year category for *"Uchiage Hanabi"*, and in the Best Breakthrough Artist category. In July 2020 she released the album *"anima"*.

[Official Site](https://sxixm.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SiM_Official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sim_japan) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcrvP_Z93Zts_Xd7UGKH2CQ)

SiM ("Silence iz Mine") is a Japanese alternative metal band. Their musical style mixes heavy metal, alternative, hip hop, ska, reggae, dub and punk with rebellious lyrics (mostly in English). The band signed with Pony Canyon in 2022 and released their single "The Rumbling", used as the opening theme for the anime *Attack on Titan: The Final Season Part 2*. The single managed to enter US Billboard charts.

__Current Members:__
- [MAH](https://anilist.co/staff/299468) (vocals; founding member)
- SHOW-HATE (guitar)
- SIN (bass)
- GODRi (drums)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265852551)

Married to fellow animator [Noriko Morishima](https://anilist.co/staff/111797/).

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Final Fantasy VII (Video Game, 1997) (2D Animation Assistance)
- Final Fantasy X (Video Game, 2001) (Storyboard Design)
- Final Fantasy XII (Videogame, 2006) (Storyboard)
- Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII (Video Game, 2007) (Continuity Design)
- Final Fantasy IV (Video Game, 2007) (Storyboard)
- Final Fantasy XIII (Video Game, 2009) (Storyboard Design)

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/110221339) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/815589398720847872)
